p: Concern about retroviruses led to the initiation of antibody testing for HTLV (1 and 2) in a number of countries and subsequently, the identification of HCV, the virus causing non-A, non-B hepatitis, led to the development of antibody tests for this infection. Subsequently, testing for antibodies to Trypanosoma cruzi, the agent of Chagas disease, was implemented in the United States, although it has been in place for many years in South and Central America and parts of Mexico.
